dct_title_s: The Dutch colony of the Cape of Good Hope
dct_description_sm: by L.S. De La Rochette ; engraved by W. Faden ; 2nd ed., corrected Dec. 1, 1795 ; Scale approximately 1:528,000 ; Relief shown by shading, hachures and pictorially ; Prime Meridian: London ; Very slight red coloration consists of a single line describing route of the British Army and the location of Cape Town ; Map shows navigation hazards and water soundings near islands and various bays ; Map shows family names and location of farms and settlements ; Includes decorative title cartouche with palms, native huts and settlers on horseback hunting elephants ; 'Degree of the meridian measured in the year 1752 by l'Abbe de la Caille, and found to equal 57-037 Parisian Toises.' ; London : W. Faden
dct_rights_sm: The images on this web site, from maps in the collection of the Melville J. Herskovits Library of African Studies and housed in the Government & Geographic Information Collection of Northwestern University Libraries are in the public domain in the United States, and as such, not subject to copyright restriction. The Libraries request users cite both the URL and Northwestern University Libraries if they wish to reproduce images from the repository. For access to higher resolution images please contact repository@northwestern.edu
